noun.description: Any of the more or less distinct parts into which something is or may be divided or from which it is made up.
examples: arrange orange sections on a platter

noun.description: A distinct group within a larger body of people or things.
examples: the children's section of the library

noun.description: The cutting of a solid by or along a plane.

examples: she began to section the grapefruit

verb.description: Commit (someone) compulsorily to a psychiatric hospital in accordance with a section of a mental health act.

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun): from French section or Latin sectio(n-), from secare to cut. The verb dates from the early 19th century.
